Supreme power grab  —  For thirty years, federal law has required commercial fishing boats to include a trained observer to ensure the vessel does not engage in overfishing or other prohibited practices.  The law specifies that certain classes of boats pay the costs of their own monitors.

Conservatives Go to War — Against Each Other — Over School Vouchers  —  School choice advocates are intent on expanding the availability of vouchers to fund private education at the expense of public schools, but rural residents of these targeted states are putting up some of the strongest resistance.

US to criminally charge Boeing, seek guilty plea, sources say  —  The U.S. Justice Department will criminally charge Boeing (BA.N) with fraud over two fatal crashes and ask the planemaker to plead guilty or face a trial, two people familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

Meet the sporadic voters who could decide the 2024 election  —  Polls show Trump leading among voters who didn't participate in 2020.  The question is: Will they show up in 2024?  —  Neither Joseph Mitchum nor Laura Brooks participated in the last presidential election four years ago.
